checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
Dimethylhydrazine moiety is mentioned in the Examples section of the dataset's website: https://opencatalystproject.org/index.html
Also known as UDMH, it is explicitly referenced by Wikipedia and scientific literature as being used in "launch tests of satellites, spacecraft and other military devices."  : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsymmetrical_dimethylhydrazine

Needs a scientific reviewer/expert's advice.

checks.name: Prompts / Fine-tuning Scripts
checks.notes: no user files provided

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes:
Atomistic systems represented as:

Atomic numbers

3D atomic positions

Periodic boundary conditions

Lattice vectors

Labels include:

Total energy (eV)

Atomic forces (eV/Å)

Stress tensors (for selected tasks)

Stored in LMDB format optimized for large-scale training

Supports supervised learning tasks:

Structure → Energy & Forces (S2EF)

Initial Structure → Relaxed Structure (IS2RS)

Initial Structure → Relaxed Energy (IS2RE)

Raising the risk level to Low to keep in sight.

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
FAIR Chemistry License v1 ( a custom license by Meta).
Permissions:

Use - Use the Materials (models, code, weights, documentation)

Reproduce - Copy the Materials

Distribute - Share the Materials with third parties

Modify - Make modifications to the Materials

Create Derivative Works - Build upon the Materials

Commercial Use - License is royalty-free (no payment required)

Worldwide - License applies globally

Own Derivatives - You own derivative works and modifications you create

Publish Research - Can publish research results using the Materials

Restrictions:

Non-Transferable - License cannot be transferred to others

Acceptable Use Policy Compliance - Must follow prohibited use restrictions (military, nuclear, weapons, ITAR, espionage, etc.)

Geographic Restrictions - Not available in comprehensively sanctioned jurisdictions, China, Russia, and Belarus

Termination on Litigation - License terminates if you sue Meta over the Materials

Indemnification - Must hold Meta harmless from third-party claims arising from your use

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
Primary Training Datasets
1. OC20 (Open Catalyst 2020)

1,281,040 DFT relaxations (~264,890,000 single-point evaluations)
Covers wide range of materials, surfaces, and adsorbates (nitrogen, carbon, oxygen chemistries)
Purpose: Catalyst discovery for renewable energy applications
Source: Meta AI / Open Catalyst Project

2. OC22 (Open Catalyst 2022)

Extension focusing on oxide materials
Used to demonstrate data efficiency vs. GemNet-OC
Source: Meta AI / Open Catalyst Project

Comparison/Ablation Dataset
3. QM9

Used for comparison with original Equiformer
Standard benchmark for molecular property prediction
~134K small organic molecules with quantum chemical properties

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: No fine-tuning for downstream tasks are available.

checks.name: FLOPS Calculation
checks.notes: Maximum parameters range from 10 to 100 million for different variants. Given the number of samples and the model parameters, the max FLOPs can not reach or exceed 10^27.

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes: low risk, no inspection conducted.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes: A GNN to predict molecular energies and atomic forces from 3D molecular structures. Will be used by the project for self-supervised learning techniques to build a large-scale foundation model. Aligns with approved research topics Material Sciences and Datascience & engineering

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
The following was found in the paper of GemNet. 

"Societal impacts. Accelerating molecular simulations can have positive effects in a wide range of applications in physics and chemistry. At the same time, however, this can be used for malicious purposes such as developing chemical agents or weapons. To the best of our knowledge, this work does not promote these use cases more than regular chemistry research does. To somewhat mitigate negative effects we will publish our source code under the Hippocratic license."

Coupled with scientific review this risk will be mitigated.

checks.name: Training Data Documentation
checks.notes:
QM9 (small organic molecules, ~130k samples, quantum chemical properties)

MD17 (molecular dynamics trajectories for small molecules)

COLL (collision datasets)

Also used QM7-x for molecular dynamics robustness tests

Some variants were jointly trained or fine-tuned on OC20 + OC22 (OC22 = Open Catalyst 2022, focused on oxides)

checks.name: Customisation / Fine-tuning
checks.notes: No customization or fine tuning done of the foundation model.

Parameters:
Typical range: ~5M → 40M parameters

Tokens: 
Of the order of 100K. 

No FLOPs calculation done because this is well below the threshold.

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes: Low risk. Skipping inspection.

observations:
In Open Catalyst dataset, a scientific review is needed to mitigate the risk of dual use.
In Open Materials dataset,  a scientific review is needed to mitigate the risk of dual use.
In Open Molecules 2025  dataset, the artifact is new and less used.

In GemNet model, a scientific review is needed to mitigate the risk of dual use.
recommendation: Low risk overall. Recommended for grand challenge.
